articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 35 Palestinians in aerial and ground bombardments across the Gaza Strip on Thursday and battled in close combat with Hamas-led militants in areas of the southern city of Rafah, health officials and Hamas media said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill dozens of Palestinians as they push deeper in Gaza's north and south

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: The European Union will convene donors next week to keep Syria on the global agenda, but as the economic and social burden of refugees on neighbouring countries mounts the bloc is divided and unable to find solutions to tackle the issue, diplomats say.
articles.title: Divisions, elections and Assad lay bare Europe's Syrian quagmire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian attack on Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv killed two people and injured at least seven, local authorities said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills two, injures at least seven, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military started its second day of war games around Taiwan on Friday, with drills to test their ability to "seize power" and control key areas, exercises it has said were launched to punish Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te.
articles.title: China starts second day of war games around Taiwan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea on Friday imposed sanctions on seven North Korean individuals and two Russian vessels over weapons trade and other activities between Pyongyang and Moscow deemed in breach of U.N. Security Council resolutions, Seoul's foreign ministry said.
articles.title: South Korea imposes sanctions on North Koreans, two Russian vessels

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden welcomed Kenyan President William Ruto to the White House on Thursday for a state visit, with both leaders pledging a new era of partnership on technology and security.
articles.title: Biden welcomes Kenya's Ruto to White House with investments, promises

articles.author: Kate Holton, William James
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his Labour Party rival Keir Starmer kicked off their election campaigns on Thursday, each arguing that only they can snap the country out of its economic and political malaise.
articles.title: Sunak and Starmer hit UK campaign trail after shock election call

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and several of its allies, including Britain, Canada, Australia, Germany and Japan, issued a joint statement on Friday calling on Taiwan to be allowed to take part in a key meeting of the World Health Organisation this month.
articles.title: U.S., allies call for Taiwan to be allowed to take part in WHO meeting

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: Three U.S. troops suffered non-combat injuries in the effort to make a temporary pier off the coast of Gaza into a conduit for humanitarian aid, with one in critical condition at an Israeli hospital, U.S. officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Three US troops have non-combat injuries during Gaza pier operation

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel, Kirsty Needham
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday after a day of talks in New Caledonia that he would delay a voting reform that had triggered deadly riots on the French-ruled Pacific island, and try to seek a new political agreement.
articles.title: In riot-scarred New Caledonia, France's Macron delays voting reform
